Package nusri.fyp.demo.state_machine

Class StateMachine

java.lang.Object
nusri.fyp.demo.state_machine.StateMachine
public class StateMachine extends Object

StateMachine maintains a state graph based on Node and performs state updates based on different action-object observations. When Quota is enabled, it uses the traditional logic; when Quota is disabled, it skips.

Main Methods:
  • updateStateProbability(List, double, ConfigService): Updates state in real-time when Quota is enabled; if Quota is disabled, it skips this step.
  • #clearAndUpdateToTime(double, ConfigService): Clears state and recalculates up to a given time point; if Quota is disabled, it skips this step.
  • getMostProbableState(): Returns the current node with the highest probability.

    The Preset associated with this StateMachine, which contains configuration and process information.
    private final LocalDateTime
    startTime
    The time at which the StateMachine was started, used as a reference point.

  • Constructor Details

    • StateMachine

      public StateMachine(Preset preset)
      Constructs a StateMachine based on the provided Preset.
      Parameters:
      preset - The preset containing the configuration for the state machine.

  • Method Details

    • getNodesByS

      public List<Node> getNodesByS(String s)
      Retrieves all nodes that can receive the specified action.
      Parameters:
      s - The action-object string (e.g., "action-object").
      Returns:
      A list of nodes that can process the given action.

    • getNpByS

      public List<Node> getNpByS(Node n, String s)
      Finds the predecessor nodes for a given node (n) and action (s).
      Parameters:
      n - The target node.
      s - The action-object string.
      Returns:
      A list of nodes that can be predecessors of the given node for the specified action.

    • updateStateProbability

      public void updateStateProbability(List<AbstractActionObservation> obs, double timestamp, ConfigService configService)
      Updates the state probabilities and accumulates the work time for each node based on action observations. This method works when Quota is enabled. If Quota is disabled, the method will skip the real-time update.
      Parameters:
      obs - The list of action observations at the current timestamp.
      timestamp - The current time (in seconds).
      configService - The configuration service used to access Quota settings.

    • clearAndUpdateToTime

      public void clearAndUpdateToTime(double tillTimestamp, ConfigService configService, List<String> actions, List<String> objects)
      Resets the states of all nodes and recalculates up to the specified time point.
      If Quota is enabled, the state update occurs using the traditional method;
      if Quota is disabled, it skips.
      Parameters:
      tillTimestamp - The timestamp (in seconds) up to which the state is recalculated. This is relative to startTime.
      configService - The service that provides configuration information.
      actions - The list of possible actions for the current operation.
      objects - The list of possible objects for the current operation.

    • isDisabled

      public static boolean isDisabled(ConfigService configService, String presetName)
      Checks if the Quota for the given preset is disabled by consulting the configuration service. The result is cached for efficiency.
      Parameters:
      configService - The configuration service to access Quota settings.
      presetName - The name of the preset to check.
      Returns:
      true if Quota is disabled for the specified preset, false otherwise.

    • clearP

      private void clearP()
      Clears all node probabilities and first allocation information, but retains the visit probability. If you want to clear the visit probability as well, you can do so by calling Node.clear().

    • getMostProbableState

      public PresetNode getMostProbableState()
      Returns the PresetNode object corresponding to the current node with the highest probability. If all nodes have no probability, it returns the PresetNode corresponding to the Idle node (if it matches).
      Returns:
      The PresetNode corresponding to the node with the highest probability.
